Sentence.sentence: Travel was arduous and costly throughout the period, possible only for a privileged class—the same that produced gentlemen scientists, authors, antique experts, and patrons of the arts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the past, health experts warned us that the day would come in which it would become very difficult to provide medical care for even common problems such as lung infection or severe sour throat.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Why, then, has this claim become so popular?Part of the answer is that this is what always happens during periods of high unemployment—in part because experts and analysts believe that declaring the problem deeply rooted, with no easy answers, makes them sound serious.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Virtually all experts agree that the fee-for-service system—doctors are rewarded for the quantity of care rather than its quality of effectiveness—is a primary reason that the cost of care is so high.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To testify to the experts' analysis of America's problems.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Overly strict standards often fail, James Bartram, a WHO water-health expert, said.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I've been looking at what self-proclaimed experts were saying about unemployment during the Great Depression; it was almost identical to what Very Serious People are saying now.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: U.N. weather expert Geoffrey Love says that is the bad news.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: As lighting expert Howard Brandston points out, Generally, there are no bad light sources, only bad applications.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It notes that, in recent years, experts have come to the conclusion that undernourishment between conception and a child’s second birthday can have serious and long-lasting impacts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Casey, an expert in this field, suggests that the cooperation process within teams mustbe organized, promoted and managed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The form and style are very familiar, and best of all, you are the world-class expert on the subject of YOU .
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Guided by expert knowledge from a panel of science-focused career advisers, each trainee's self-assessment is used to rank a set of career trajectories(轨迹)
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Analyzing data from the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, among others, and consulting with experts and academics, we measured 28 factors to come up with our rankings.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Experts see a movement toward the use of mobile technology in education, though they say it is in its infancy as professors try to come up with useful applications.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some experts say that the rain forest is already at the
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Experts on leadership will quickly point out that "how things get done" influences the success of the outcomes and indicates a right way and a wrong way to do things.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many experts now believe that given the right policies, the effects, though grave, need not be catastrophic.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Paul Phillips, an expert from the High Field Hospital.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Many environmental experts now believe that methane is more responsible for global warming than carbon dioxide.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Surrounded by open ocean, it is also vulnerable, but Antarctic experts disagree strongly on just how unstable it is.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Health experts advise that the average woman should consume about 2,000 calories a day and a man about 2,500 calories to maintain a healthy weight
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: What warning did some health experts give?
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: It was invented by a group of language experts in the year of 1887.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "If they are anywhere near worth their salt as engineers, I bet they are rethinking their threat model as we speak," said Jonathan Zdziarski, a digital expert who studies the iPhone and its vulnerabilities.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: "Overly strict standards often fail," James Bartram, a WHO water-health expert, said.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: As lighting expert Howard Brandston points out, " Generally, there are no bad light sources, only bad applications. "

Sentence.sentence: Casey, an expert in this field, suggests that the cooperation process within teams must be organized, promoted and managed.

Sentence.sentence: Expert performance is not beyond thought.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, when the expert pays attention to the mechanics, it is liable to disrupt performance.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It turns out that the less skilled pianist spends more time looking at her fingers than does the expert who, in contrast, is more likely to be looking at the sheet music, or looking ahead at keys he's not yet playing.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Some "expert amateurs" in the satellite game could provide some inspiration for how to proceed responsibly.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The expert review also found insufficient evidence to recommend any drugs or dietary supplements that could prevent or slow cognitive decline.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The eye tracker gives expert and learning performers a glimpse into what they do without thinking about it.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: This has led some to say that the expert operates in a zone "beyond thought", in a state of flow.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都有"熟练的"之意。
means: expert ： 特指有某项专长，有某方面经验。
proficient ： 多指擅长于某事，侧重技艺或科学方面。
skillful ： 指在工作或操作中表现出灵巧、熟练。
skilled ： 通常指已掌握某行业的专业技能或手段，或已有从事某一专门工作的本领或技术。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 凭经验[或观察]的,经验主义的
stems_affixes.word_buile: empiric[n.经验主义者,[古]江湖医生]+al……的→adj.凭经验[或观察]的,经验主义的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实验的, 根据实验的
stems_affixes.word_buile: experiment实验+al……的→adj.实验的, 根据实验的
ex出+pert=peri尝试→尝试出来→[成为]专家, 行家

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实验上, 用实验方法
stems_affixes.word_buile: experimental实验的+ly……地→adv.实验上, 用实验方法

stems_affixes.value_cn: 经验主义者,[古]江湖医生
stems_affixes.word_buile: em出+piri=peri尝试+c→尝试出来的→经验
empiric[n.经验主义者,[古]江湖医生]+ism主义→n.经验主义
ex出+peri尝试+ment表名词→尝试出来→实验

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实验, 试验, 实验法
stems_affixes.word_buile: experiment[n.实验;试验 v.[on]进行实验;做试验]+ation表名词→n.实验, 试验, 实验法
ex出+pert=peri尝试→尝试出来→[成为]专家, 行家
ex出+peri尝试+ence表名词→尝试出来的东西→经验
ex出+peri尝试+ment表名词→尝试出来→实验
ex出+pert=peri尝试→尝试出来→[成为]专家, 行家

Sentence.sentence: Any given performance takes a tour bus full of artists, technical experts, managers, musicians, or writers to create an appealing piece of art.

Sentence.sentence: As experts continue to study the science of risk-seeking, we'll continue to hit the mountains, the waves or the shallow end of the pool.

Sentence.sentence: Experts say it's an invaluable social practice that results in big benefits.

Sentence.sentence: Experts say Paris is right: for a sudden heart failure, the single best chance for survival is having someone nearby step in and do CPR quickly.

Sentence.sentence: I have people coming to me saying, you are the bird expert.

Sentence.sentence: Loe is a master food preserver, gardener and canning expert.

Sentence.sentence: Other experts say part of the problem is chemical.

Sentence.sentence: Painters, digital media experts, photographers, booking agents and promoters are hired to sell tickets and promote the event.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 填空题 原文

Sentence.sentence: People had been writing novels for a century—most experts date the first novel to Robinson Crusoe in 1719—but nobody wanted to do it professionally.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Professors are not trained nurses, financial aid experts or your best friends.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Some experts are skeptical about 3D food printers, believing they are better suited for fast food restaurants than homes and high-end restaurants.

Sentence.sentence: Some experts believe printers could use hydrocolloids from plentiful renewables like algae and grass to replace the familiar ingredients.

Sentence.sentence: Some experts doubt 3D food printing.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Some experts say that women will become more effective managers than men because they have the power to reach common goals in a way that traditional male managers cannot.

Sentence.sentence: Some experts think reading is the fundamental skill upon which school education depends.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Some language experts believe that 10000 years ago, when the world had just five to ten million people, they spoke perhaps 1200 languages between them.

Sentence.sentence: Talking to someone you don't know is not the easiest thing to do! some experts say with more practice, small talk does get easier.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 任务型读写 原文

Sentence.sentence: There is an educator expert at training future teachers.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

Sentence.sentence: This upsets me to no end because while all the experts are busy debating about which option is been the people who want to improve their lives are left confused by all of the conflicting information.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The upside is the possibilities contained in knowing that everything is up to us； where before we were experts in the array of limitations， now we become authorities of what is possible.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Far less certain, however, is how successfully experts and bureaucrats can select our peer groups and steer their activities in virtuous directions.

mean.mean: 熟练的；内行的；专家的；经验（或知识）丰富的

entry.def: An expert is a person who is very skilled at doing something or who knows a lot about a particular subject.

example.ex: Our team of experts will be on hand to offer help and advice between 12 noon and 7pm daily.
example.tran: 每天中午12点到下午7点，我们的专家小组将随时提供帮助和建议。

entry.def: Someone who is expert at doing something is very skilled at it.
entry.tran: 技术娴熟的;熟练的;在行的

example.ex: The Japanese are expert at lowering manufacturing costs...
example.tran: 日本人在降低制造成本方面很在行。

example.ex: There is a great deal to learn from Hal's expert approach.
example.tran: 从哈尔熟练的方法中可以学到很多。

entry.def: If you say that someone has expert hands or an expert eye, you mean that they are very skilful or experienced in using their hands or eyes for a particular purpose.

example.ex: When the horse suffered a back injury Harvey cured it with his own expert hands...
example.tran: 那匹马背部受伤后，哈维用他内行的双手把它治好了。

example.ex: The symptoms are very mild and it takes an expert eye to see them.
example.tran: 症状非常轻，要靠专家的眼睛才能看出来。

entry.def: Expert advice or help is given by someone who has studied a subject thoroughly or who is very skilled at a particular job.

example.ex: You'll also get expert advice on keeping your hair in good condition...
example.tran: 你还会获得有关如何保持良好发质的专家建议。
我们需要听听专家的意见。

means.word_mean: 1. a person with special knowledge or ability who performs skillfully
1. having or showing knowledge and skill and aptitude;

sentences.sentence: "a lesser-known but no less skillful composer"
"the effect was achieved by skillful retouching"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as an adjective): from French, from Latin expertus, past participle of experiri 'try'. The noun use dates from the early 19th cent. Compare with experience and experiment

sentences.cn: 沃克利的观点受到大部分专家的支持.
sentences.en: Walkley's view is seconded by most experts.

sentences.cn: 我们重新发掘了我们自己, 再次在我们还不是专家的领域开始研究.
sentences.en: We're reinventing ourselves, starting again in fields where we're not the experts anymore.

sentences.cn: 这两个模块采用数据挖掘技术, 从而减少了对专家的依赖.
sentences.en: To decrease the dependence of the expert, ASM and AMM adopt data mining technology.

sentences.cn: 从哈尔熟练的方法中可以学到很多。
sentences.en: There is a great deal to learn from Hal's expert approach.

sentences.cn: 熟练的滑雪者常常寻找普通滑雪者不走的但是更具挑战性的路线.
sentences.en: Expert skiers often look for more challenging routes than those the average skier takes.

sentences.cn: 外科大夫以熟练的技术把肿瘤割掉.
sentences.en: The surgeon cut away the tumor with expert skill.

sentences.cn: 外科大夫用熟练的技术把肿瘤切去.
sentences.en: The surgeon cut away the tumour with expert skill.

sentences.cn: 除了她所有的其他技能外, 贝茜还是一个熟练的厨师.
sentences.en: In addition to all her other qualifications, Bessie was an expert cook.

sentences.cn: 从哈尔熟练的方法中可以学到很多。
sentences.en: There is a great deal to learn from Hal's expert approach.

sentences.cn: 粉刷墙壁,我是行家;谈恋爱, 我是老手;在秘鲁, 我又是一个亡命之徒.
sentences.en: I am an expert in stucco, a veteran in love, and an outlaw in Peru.

sentences.cn: 我看女孩子已经看了40年了(我已经40岁了), 不要和像我这样的老手争论.
sentences.en: I have been looking at girls for 40 years, do not argue with the expert.

sentences.cn: 他是已经抢了6家银行的老手.
sentences.en: He was an expert who had already knocked over six banks.
